question_text: An administrator assigns a static IP to a server that falls within the DHCP pool but does not reserve it. What is the potential consequence?
answer_options: The server will not boot properly
The DHCP server will disable that IP permanently
An IP conflict could occur if another device is assigned the same IP
The server will override DHCP assignments for all clients
correct_answer: An IP conflict could occur if another device is assigned the same IP
explanation: Static IPs must not fall within the DHCP pool unless properly reserved, or else conflicts can occur with dynamic clients.
